title: Mission, vision, values
text:
The Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Outreach Group, a community of statisticians and data scientists, is committed to communication, programming, and professional development to advance and support a society that values all people.

title: JEDI Outreach Group
text:
Tweets by DataSciJedi 





The Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Outreach Group, a community of statisticians and data scientists, is committed to communication, programming, and professional development to advance and support a society that values all people.
JEDI is an outreach group of the American Statistical Association.
Complete this form to become a member.

title: JEDI Outreach Group
text: The Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Outreach Group, a community of statisticians and data scientists, is committed to communication, programming, and professional development to advance and support a society that values all people.

title: DataSci JEDI
text:
We welcome and value contributions from everyone.


Below are some ways in which you can help.

Code contributions (typo fixes, website enhancements, improving documentation, etc.)
Design contributions (e.g. graphic design for the website and/or social media)
Cloud/Infrastructure Sponsorship - Having cloud/infrastructure resources would help lower the barrier for us to add more functionality to our website. If you are interested in supporting the JEDI Outreach Group by providing such resources, please contact us at admin@datascijedi.org.
Website expertise - If you’re knowledgable about website development (e.g. creating the backend for a website application), we would be interested in hearing your ideas (whether you can provide development time or not). Please get in touch at admin@datascijedi.org.
Any other ideas? Feel free to open a Github issue to suggest and discuss ideas, or get in touch with us at admin@datascijedi.org.




For code contributions, please submit a PR using the following steps:

Fork the datascijedi/website repository.
Create a branch using a descriptive name (e.g. my-awesome-feature) and make your additions there.
Create a pull request from my-awesome-branch in your forked repository to the main branch of the datascijedi/website repository.




We use the Quarto framework for website development. Below are some steps to get up and running:

Download and install Quarto from https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/.
Fork and clone this repository.
Navigate to the root of the cloned repository and run quarto preview. This should open up a local version of this website in your browser.

There are various ways to develop using Quarto, so feel free to check out the official Quarto docs for more information.

title: History
text:
Note



Amstat article on the history of the group is here: https://magazine.amstat.org/blog/2021/05/01/the-origins-of-jedi/
We can also pull from the first JEDI corner for this: https://magazine.amstat.org/blog/2021/10/01/jedi-corner-october-2021/


In particular: "The American Statistical Association has established the Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Outreach Group to develop a diverse and inclusive environment that embraces all statisticians and data scientists, as well as to study and address statistical methods that can potentially introduce or exacerbate inequities and injustices in our society. Accordingly, we are committed to communication, programming, and professional development to advance and support a society that values all people."






Note



TO DO: More detailed discussion of role of JEDI in statistics?

title: Resources
text:
Our partners/broader community links:

Statistics without Borders https://www.statisticswithoutborders.org/ 
Caucus for Women in Statistics https://cwstat.org/ 

Links to resources:

https://labs.icahn.mssm.edu/bennlab/antiracism-resources/
https://library.osu.edu/researchcommons/2020/06/17  (Web view)
https://medicine-matters.blogs.hopkinsmedicine.org/files/2016  (Web view)
https://www.cdc.gov/healthcommunication/Preferred_Terms.html  (Web view)
Donna and Yates have started to compile resources, could transfer those here

A possible example for the type of resources to share:  See: https://cwstat.org/professional-development-resources/ or https://cwstat.org/publications/cws-library/ (although the formatting could be better for this library)

title: Sign Up
text:
Note



Note: This is the production JEDI form.


Become a member of the JEDI Outreach Group by filling out the form below. Members receive emails from our chair on JEDI-related news, can contribute to the community by joining one of our committees, vote for future committee board members, and more.
